tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to modify the approval website's link expiration. Currently, the link expires after 15 minutes as a security measure, but Levi wants it to remain active until tasks are submitted, ensuring users have ample time to review and approve or reject items. Joe will explore this and confirm by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Modify approval website timeout to expire after task submission rather than time-based expiration

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to implement Discord messaging for task review notifications. This involves sending the same website link used for email approvals to a new Discord channel, pinging relevant team members. The goal is to streamline task review broadcasts for the team, to be done by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Implement Discord messaging integration for task review notifications in new team channel

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to change the button text in the approval emails. The current 'approve' button should be updated to 'review tasks' to provide clearer instructions to users interacting with the human-in-the-loop approval system. This is a small but important clarity improvement to be completed by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Change email button text from 'approve' to 'review tasks' for clarity

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to set up meetings with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala. The purpose of these meetings is to discuss and determine how to conceptually separate and categorize different projects within Monday.com, which is crucial for the upcoming full reorganization of the platform. Joe is expected to meet with them tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Set up meetings with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala to discuss project categorization and Monday.com organization

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to complete a full reorganization of Monday.com. This involves moving hundreds of existing tasks to appropriate boards and categories, aiming for a neat and logical structure. This is a super high-priority task to be completed by the end of the current week.
tasks.task_item: Complete full reorganization of Monday.com including moving hundreds of tasks to appropriate boards by end of week

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to research historical task completion dates. Joe needs to go through past meeting recordings to find approximate completion dates for tasks and update their status accordingly in Monday.com, ensuring the platform accurately reflects project progress. This is part of the Monday.com cleanup this week.
tasks.task_item: Research historical task completion dates from meeting recordings to update Monday.com status

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to modify the custom approval website. The website currently bundles multiple meetings on a single page, and Joe needs to ensure it displays only one meeting per section or page for improved clarity and user experience, allowing individual review. This is expected to be completed by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Ensure website displays one meeting per section/page rather than bundling multiple meetings

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned Joe Maina to implement real-time task processing on the approval website. Once a task is approved or rejected by a user, it should be immediately pushed to Monday.com or dropped from the system, ensuring the dashboard reflects the most current status without delay. This is expected to be completed by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Implement real-time task processing where approved/rejected items are immediately pushed to Monday.com or dropped

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned himself to discuss the Monday.com organization strategy with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala tonight. The goal is to determine the optimal workspace and board structure, considering the interdependencies of projects, to facilitate the upcoming full reorganization of the platform.
tasks.task_item: Discuss Monday.com organization strategy with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala tonight to determine workspace/board structure

tasks.brief_description: Joe Maina requested Levi Rybalov to provide GitHub repository access permissions. Joe is currently facing restrictions when trying to connect company code with other websites, requiring him to use both personal and company accounts. Levi needs to resolve this access issue.
tasks.task_item: Provide GitHub repository access permissions to resolve Joe's deployment restrictions

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned himself to schedule a follow-up meeting with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala. This meeting is intended to occur on Thursday, after Joe Maina's initial discussions with them, to ensure the Monday.com reorganization efforts are on track and to finalize the strategy.
tasks.task_item: Schedule follow-up meeting with Yang Zheng and Vardhan Shorewala on Thursday after Joe's initial meetings

tasks.brief_description: Levi Rybalov assigned himself to create a new Discord channel. This channel will serve as a broadcast channel for task review notifications, where the website link for approvals will be shared, allowing team members to review and approve or reject tasks. Levi stated he would make the channel immediately.
tasks.task_item: Create a new Discord channel for task review broadcasts

tasks.brief_description: Joe Maina assigned himself to rename a board in Monday.com. The board currently has a 'long remix label' which is causing confusion, and Joe will update it for clarity. This is a minor organizational cleanup task to be completed within five business days.
tasks.task_item: Rename the 'long remix label' board in Monday.com

tasks.brief_description: Joe Maina assigned himself to take a screenshot of the GitHub permission prompt he encounters when trying to share code. He will then send this screenshot to Levi Rybalov to help Levi understand and resolve the issue of direct access permissions to the company repository. This is expected to be done by tomorrow.
tasks.task_item: Take a screenshot of GitHub permission prompt and send to Levi
